A student writes down the reaction shown for tritium (hydrogen-3) decaying into helium-3. Another student claims that the reaction is written incorrectly. Which of the following supports the claim that the written reaction is incorrect?
choicesHtml: Changing the number of protons within a nucleus violates conservation of charge.
Changing the number of neutrons within a nucleus violates conservation of nucleon number.
Creating a neutrino without also creating an antineutrino violates conservation of neutrino number.
Creating an electron and a neutrino without also creating antiparticles violates conservation of lepton number.
